meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jay Peterson Jessie Christensen Lloyd Caesar Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6229.

td.p: Jay Peterson, an English professor from Howell, New Jersey
Jessie Christensen, a librarian from Orem, Utah
Lloyd Caesar, an office manager from Watervliet, New York (whose 1-day cash winnings total $22,359)

tr.td: SPORTS & CIVIL RIGHTS
LITERARY STUPID ANSWERS
CONJUNCTIONS
MEET THE FLINT STONES
AT SIXES & SEVENS
YUM "O"!

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Alex: He was a great catcher.)

the (New York) Yankees

Jessie
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '8 years after Jackie Robinson broke in with the Dodgers, Elston Howard became the first black player on this A.L. rival')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Three brothers had many, many, many hits. The youngest brother had a number of hits on his own.)
...
(Alex: I\'m going home whistling and singing "Night Fever", and we\'ll see you all tomorrow right here.)
JessieWho is Michael Jackson?
$10,000
LloydWho is Andy Gibb?
$12,599
JayWho is Andy Gibb?
$8,801
Andy Gibb')

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
